member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration
member.summary: Global settings for building. Should not contain any target-specific settings.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bIgnoreOutdatedImportLibraries
member.summary: Whether to ignore import library files that are out of date when building targets. Set this to true to improve iteration time. By default, we do not bother re-linking targets if only a dependent .lib has changed, as chances are that the import library was not actually different unless a dependent header file of this target was also changed, in which case the target would automatically be rebuilt.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bUsePrecompiled
member.summary: Use existing static libraries for all engine modules in this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bPrintDebugInfo
member.summary: Whether debug info should be written to the console.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bAllowHybridExecutor
member.summary: Whether the hybrid executor will be used (a remote executor and local executor).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bAllowHordeCompute
member.summary: Whether Horde remote compute may be used. Highly experimental, disabled by default.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bAllowXGE
member.summary: Whether XGE may be used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bAllowFASTBuild
member.summary: Whether FASTBuild may be used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bAllowSNDBS
member.summary: Whether SN-DBS may be used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bUseUBTMakefiles
member.summary:
Enables support for very fast iterative builds by caching target data. Turning this on causes Unreal Build Tool to emit 'UBT Makefiles' for targets when they are built the first time. Subsequent builds will load these Makefiles and begin outdatedness checking and build invocation very quickly. The caveat is that if source files are added or removed to the project, UBT will need to gather information about those in order for your build to complete successfully. Currently, you must run the project file generator after adding/removing source files to tell UBT to re-gather this information.
Events that can invalidate the 'UBT Makefile': - Adding/removing .cpp files - Adding/removing .h files with UObjects - Adding new UObject types to a file that did not previously have any - Changing global build settings (most settings in this file qualify) - Changed code that affects how Unreal Header Tool works
You can force regeneration of the 'UBT Makefile' by passing the '-gather' argument, or simply regenerating project files.
This also enables the fast include file dependency scanning and caching system that allows Unreal Build Tool to detect out of date dependencies very quickly. When enabled, a deep C++ include graph does not have to be generated, and instead, we only scan and cache indirect includes for after a dependent build product was already found to be out of date. During the next build, we will load those cached indirect includes and check for outdatedness.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.MaxParallelActions
member.summary: Number of actions that can be executed in parallel. If 0 then code will pick a default based on the number of cores and memory available. Applies to the ParallelExecutor, HybridExecutor, and LocalExecutor

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bAllCores
member.summary: Consider logical cores when determining how many total cpu cores are available.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bForceHeaderGeneration
member.summary: If true, force header regeneration. Intended for the build machine.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bDoNotBuildUHT
member.summary: If true, do not build UHT, assume it is already built.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bFailIfGeneratedCodeChanges
member.summary: If true, fail if any of the generated header files is out of date.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bAllowHotReloadFromIDE
member.summary: True if hot-reload from IDE is allowed.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bForceDebugUnrealHeaderTool
member.summary: If true, the Debug version of UnrealHeaderTool will be built and run instead of the Development version.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bUseBuiltInUnrealHeaderTool
member.summary: If true, use C# UHT internal to UBT

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bWarnOnCppUnrealHeaderTool
member.summary: If true, generate warnings when C++ UHT is used

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bSkipRulesCompile
member.summary: Whether to skip compiling rules assemblies and just assume they are valid

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bForceRulesCompile
member.summary: Whether to force compiling rules assemblies, regardless of whether they are valid

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.MaxRootPathLength
member.summary: Maximum recommended root path length.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.MaxNestedPathLength
member.summary: Maximum length of a path relative to the root directory. Used on Windows to ensure paths are portable between machines. Defaults to off.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bIgnoreInvalidFiles
member.summary: When single file targets are specified, via -File=, -SingleFile=, or -FileList= If this option is set, no error will be produced if the source file is not included in the target. Additionally, if any file or file list is specified, the target will not be built if none of the specified files are part of that target, including the case where a file specified via -FileList= is empty.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bCompactOutputCommandLine
member.summary: Instruct the executor to write compact output e.g. only errors, if supported by the executor. This field is used to hold the value when specified from the command line or XML

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bCompactOutput
member.summary: Instruct the executor to write compact output e.g. only errors, if supported by the executor, and only if output is not being redirected e.g. during a build from within Visual Studio

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.StaticAnalyzerCheckers
member.summary: The static analyzer checkers that should be enabled rather than the defaults. This is only supported for Clang. See https://clang.llvm.org/docs/analyzer/checkers.html for a full list. Or run: 'clang -Xclang -analyzer-checker-help' or: 'clang -Xclang -analyzer-checker-help-alpha' for the list of experimental checkers.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.StaticAnalyzerDisabledCheckers
member.summary: The static analyzer default checkers that should be disabled. Unused if StaticAnalyzerCheckers is populated. This is only supported for Clang. This overrides the default disabled checkers, which are deadcode.DeadStores and security.FloatLoopCounter See https://clang.llvm.org/docs/analyzer/checkers.html for a full list. Or run: 'clang -Xclang -analyzer-checker-help' or: 'clang -Xclang -analyzer-checker-help-alpha' for the list of experimental checkers.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.StaticAnalyzerAdditionalCheckers
member.summary: The static analyzer non-default checkers that should be enabled. Unused if StaticAnalyzerCheckers is populated. This is only supported for Clang. See https://clang.llvm.org/docs/analyzer/checkers.html for a full list. Or run: 'clang -Xclang -analyzer-checker-help' or: 'clang -Xclang -analyzer-checker-help-alpha' for the list of experimental checkers.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bEnforceIWYU
member.summary: Enforce "include what you use" rules when PCHUsage is set to ExplicitOrSharedPCH; warns when monolithic headers (Engine.h, UnrealEd.h, etc...) are used, and checks that source files include their matching header first.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bAddDefaultIncludePaths
member.summary: Whether to add all the default include paths to the module (eg. the Source/Classes folder, subfolders under Source/Public).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bIgnoreUnresolvedSymbols
member.summary: Whether to ignore dangling (i.e. unresolved external) symbols in modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bPrecompile
member.summary: Whether this module should be precompiled. Defaults to the bPrecompile flag from the target. Clear this flag to prevent a module being precompiled.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bUsePrecompiled
member.summary: Whether this module should use precompiled data. Always true for modules created from installed assemblies.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bAllowConfidentialPlatformDefines
member.summary: Whether this module can use PLATFORM_XXXX style defines, where XXXX is a confidential platform name. This is used to ensure engine or other shared code does not reveal confidential information inside an #if PLATFORM_XXXX block. Licensee game code may want to allow for them, however.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicIncludePathModuleNames
member.summary: List of modules names (no path needed) with header files that our module's public headers needs access to, but we don't need to "import" or link against.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicDependencyModuleNames
member.summary: List of public dependency module names (no path needed) (automatically does the private/public include). These are modules that are required by our public source files.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrivateIncludePathModuleNames
member.summary: List of modules name (no path needed) with header files that our module's private code files needs access to, but we don't need to "import" or link against.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrivateDependencyModuleNames
member.summary: List of private dependency module names. These are modules that our private code depends on but nothing in our public include files depend on.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CircularlyReferencedDependentModules
member.summary: Only for legacy reason, should not be used in new code. List of module dependencies that should be treated as circular references. This modules must have already been added to either the public or private dependent module list.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicSystemIncludePaths
member.summary: List of system/library include paths - typically used for External (third party) modules. These are public stable header file directories that are not checked when resolving header dependencies.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicIncludePaths
member.summary: (This setting is currently not need as we discover all files from the 'Public' folder) List of all paths to include files that are exposed to other modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.InternalncludePaths
member.summary: (This setting is currently not need as we discover all files from the 'Internal' folder) List of all paths to include files that are exposed to other internal modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrivateIncludePaths
member.summary: List of all paths to this module's internal include files, not exposed to other modules (at least one include to the 'Private' path, more if we want to avoid relative paths)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicSystemLibraryPaths

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.TargetType

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetType.Game

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetType.Editor
member.summary: Uncooked modular editor executable and DLLs (UnrealEditor.exe, UnrealEditor*.dll, GameName*.dll)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetType.Client
member.summary: Cooked monolithic game client executable (GameNameClient.exe, but no server code)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetType.Server
member.summary: Cooked monolithic game server executable (GameNameServer.exe, but no client code)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetType.Program
member.summary: Program (standalone program, e.g. ShaderCompileWorker.exe, can be modular or monolithic depending on the program)

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.TargetLinkType
member.summary: Specifies how to link all the modules in this target

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetLinkType.Default
member.summary: Use the default link type based on the current target type

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetLinkType.Monolithic
member.summary: Link all modules into a single binary

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetLinkType.Modular
member.summary: Link modules into individual dynamic libraries

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.TargetBuildEnvironment
member.summary: Specifies whether to share engine binaries and intermediates with other projects, or to create project-specific versions. By default, editor builds always use the shared build environment (and engine binaries are written to Engine/Binaries/Platform), but monolithic builds and programs do not (except in installed builds). Using the shared build environment prevents target-specific modifications to the build environment.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetBuildEnvironment.Shared
member.summary: Engine binaries and intermediates are output to the engine folder. Target-specific modifications to the engine build environment will be ignored.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetBuildEnvironment.Unique
member.summary: Engine binaries and intermediates are specific to this target

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.PointerMemberBehavior
member.summary: Specifies how UnrealHeaderTool should enforce member pointer declarations in UCLASSes and USTRUCTs. This should match (by name, not value) the EPointerMemberBehavior enum in BaseParser.h so that it can be interpreted correctly by UnrealHeaderTool.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PointerMemberBehavior.Disallow
member.summary: Pointer members of the associated type will be disallowed and result in an error emitted from UnrealHeaderTool.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PointerMemberBehavior.AllowSilently
member.summary: Pointer members of the associated type will be allowed and not emit any messages to log or screen.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PointerMemberBehavior.AllowAndLog
member.summary: Pointer members of the associated type will be allowed but will emit messages to log.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.BuildSettingsVersion
member.summary: Determines which version of the engine to take default build settings from. This allows for backwards compatibility as new options are enabled by default.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildSettingsVersion.V1
member.summary: Legacy default build settings for 4.23 and earlier.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildSettingsVersion.V2
member.summary: New defaults for 4.24: ModuleRules.PCHUsage = PCHUsageMode.UseExplicitOrSharedPCHs, ModuleRules.bLegacyPublicIncludePaths = false.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildSettingsVersion.Latest
member.summary: Always use the defaults for the current engine version. Note that this may cause compatibility issues when upgrading.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.EngineIncludeOrderVersion
member.summary: What version of include order to use when compiling.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.EngineIncludeOrderVersion.Unreal5_0
member.summary: Include order used in Unreal 5.0

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.EngineIncludeOrderVersion.Unreal5_1
member.summary: Include order used in Unreal 5.1

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.EngineIncludeOrderVersion.Latest
member.summary: Always use the latest version of include order.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.EngineIncludeOrderVersion.Oldest
member.summary: Contains the oldest version of include order that the engine supports.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzer
member.summary: Which static analyzer to use

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzer.None
member.summary: Do not perform static analysis

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzer.Default
member.summary: Use the default static analyzer for the selected compiler, if it has one. For Visual Studio and Clang, this means using their built-in static analysis tools. Any compiler that doesn't support static analysis will ignore this option.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzer.VisualCpp
member.summary: Use the built-in Visual C++ static analyzer

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzer.PVSStudio
member.summary: Use PVS-Studio for static analysis

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzer.Clang
member.summary: Use clang for static analysis. This forces the compiler to clang.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzerOutputType
member.summary: Output type for the static analyzer. This currently only works for the Clang static analyzer. The Clang static analyzer can do either Text, which prints the analysis to stdout, or html, where it writes out a navigable HTML page for each issue that it finds, per file. The HTML is output in the same directory as the object file that would otherwise have been generated. All other analyzers default automatically to Text.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzerOutputType.Text
member.summary: Output the analysis to stdout.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzerOutputType.Html
member.summary: Output the analysis to an HTML file in the object folder.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzerMode
member.summary: Output type for the static analyzer. This currently only works for the Clang static analyzer. The Clang static analyzer can do a shallow quick analysis. However the default deep is recommended.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzerMode.Deep
member.summary: Default deep analysis.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.StaticAnalyzerMode.Shallow
member.summary: Quick analysis. Not recommended.

member.summary: Specifies the engine version to maintain backwards-compatible default build settings with (eg. DefaultSettingsVersion.Release_4_23, DefaultSettingsVersion.Release_4_24). Specify DefaultSettingsVersion.Latest to always use defaults for the current engine version, at the risk of introducing build errors while upgrading.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.ForcedIncludeOrder
member.summary: Force the include order to a specific version. Overrides any Target and Module rules.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.IncludeOrderVersion
member.summary: What version of include order to use when compiling this target. Can be overridden via -ForceIncludeOrder on the command line. ModuleRules.IncludeOrderVersion takes precedence.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.OutputFile
member.summary: Path to the output file for the main executable, relative to the Engine or project directory. This setting is only typically useful for non-UE programs, since the engine uses paths relative to the executable to find other known folders (eg. Content).

member.summary: Tracks a list of config values read while constructing this target

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsesSteam
member.summary: Whether the target uses Steam.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsesCEF3
member.summary: Whether the target uses CEF3.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsesSlate
member.summary: Whether the project uses visual Slate UI (as opposed to the low level windowing/messaging, which is always available).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseStaticCRT
member.summary: Forces linking against the static CRT. This is not fully supported across the engine due to the need for allocator implementations to be shared (for example), and TPS libraries to be consistent with each other, but can be used for utility programs.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDebugBuildsActuallyUseDebugCRT
member.summary: Enables the debug C++ runtime (CRT) for debug builds. By default we always use the release runtime, since the debug version isn't particularly useful when debugging Unreal Engine projects, and linking against the debug CRT libraries forces our third party library dependencies to also be compiled using the debug CRT (and often perform more slowly). Often it can be inconvenient to require a separate copy of the debug versions of third party static libraries simply so that you can debug your program's code.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bLegalToDistributeBinary
member.summary: Whether the output from this target can be publicly distributed, even if it has dependencies on modules that are in folders with special restrictions (eg. CarefullyRedist, NotForLicensees, NoRedist).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.UndecoratedConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the configuration whose binaries do not require a "-Platform-Configuration" suffix.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAllowHotReload
member.summary: Whether this target supports hot reload

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildAllModules
member.summary: Build all the modules that are valid for this target type. Used for CIS and making installed engine builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.VSTestRunSettingsFile
member.summary: Set this to reference a VSTest run settings file from generated projects.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.BuildPlugins
member.summary: Additional plugins that are built for this target type but not enabled.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bRuntimeDependenciesComeFromBuildPlugins
member.summary: If this is true, then the BuildPlugins list will be used to populate RuntimeDependencies, rather than EnablePlugins

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.AdditionalPlugins
member.summary: A list of additional plugins which need to be included in this target. This allows referencing non-optional plugin modules which cannot be disabled, and allows building against specific modules in program targets which do not fit the categories in ModuleHostType.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.EnablePlugins
member.summary: Additional plugins that should be included for this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.DisablePlugins
member.summary: List of plugins to be disabled for this target. Note that the project file may still reference them, so they should be marked as optional to avoid failing to find them at runtime.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.InternalPluginDependencies
member.summary: A list of Plugin names that are allowed to exist as dependencies without being defined in the uplugin descriptor

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.PakSigningKeysFile
member.summary: Path to the set of pak signing keys to embed in the executable.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.SolutionDirectory
member.summary: Allows a Program Target to specify it's own solution folder path.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildInSolutionByDefault
member.summary: Whether the target should be included in the default solution build configuration Setting this to false will skip building when running in the IDE

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bShouldCompileAsDLL
member.summary: Whether this target should be compiled as a DLL. Requires LinkType to be set to TargetLinkType.Monolithic.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.CustomConfig
member.summary: Extra subdirectory to load config files out of, for making multiple types of builds with the same platform This will get baked into the game executable as CUSTOM_CONFIG and used when staging to filter files and settings

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.ExeBinariesSubFolder
member.summary: Subfolder to place executables in, relative to the default location.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.GeneratedCodeVersion
member.summary: Allow target module to override UHT code generation version.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnableMeshEditor
member.summary: Whether to enable the mesh editor.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseVerse
member.summary: Whether to use the verse script interface.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileChaos
member.summary: Whether to compile the Chaos physics plugin.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseChaos
member.summary: Whether to use the Chaos physics interface. This overrides the physx flags to disable APEX and NvCloth

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseChaosChecked
member.summary: Whether to compile in checked chaos features for debugging

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseChaosMemoryTracking
member.summary: Whether to compile in chaos memory tracking features

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCustomSceneQueryStructure
member.summary: Whether scene query acceleration is done by UE. The physx scene query structure is still created, but we do not use it.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompilePhysX
member.summary: Whether to include PhysX support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAPEX
member.summary: Whether to include PhysX APEX support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileNvCloth
member.summary: Whether to include NvCloth.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileICU
member.summary: Whether to include ICU unicode/i18n support in Core.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileCEF3
member.summary: Whether to compile CEF3 support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileISPC
member.summary: Whether to compile using ISPC.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileIntelMetricsDiscovery
member.summary: Whether to compile IntelMetricsDiscovery.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompilePython
member.summary: Whether to compile in python support

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseGameplayDebugger
member.summary: Whether to compile with WITH_GAMEPLAY_DEBUGGER enabled and use GameplayDebugger.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseIris
member.summary: Whether to use Iris.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildEditor
member.summary: Whether we are compiling editor code or not. Prefer the more explicit bCompileAgainstEditor instead.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildRequiresCookedData
member.summary: Whether to compile code related to building assets. Consoles generally cannot build assets. Desktop platforms generally can.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildWithEditorOnlyData
member.summary: Whether to compile WITH_EDITORONLY_DATA disabled. Only Windows will use this, other platforms force this to false.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildDeveloperToolsOverride
member.summary: Manually specified value for bBuildDeveloperTools.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildDeveloperTools
member.summary: Whether to compile the developer tools.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildTargetDeveloperToolsOverride
member.summary: Manually specified value for bBuildTargetDeveloperTools.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildTargetDeveloperTools
member.summary: Whether to compile the developer tools that are for target platforms or connected devices (defaults to bBuildDeveloperTools)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceBuildTargetPlatforms
member.summary: Whether to force compiling the target platform modules, even if they wouldn't normally be built.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceBuildShaderFormats
member.summary: Whether to force compiling shader format modules, even if they wouldn't normally be built.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bNeedsExtraShaderFormatsOverride
member.summary: Override for including extra shader formats

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bNeedsExtraShaderFormats
member.summary: Whether we should include any extra shader formats. By default this is only enabled for Program and Editor targets.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileCustomSQLitePlatform
member.summary: Whether we should compile SQLite using the custom "Unreal" platform (true), or using the native platform (false).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseCacheFreedOSAllocs
member.summary: Whether to utilize cache freed OS allocs with MallocBinned

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAgainstEngine
member.summary: Enabled for all builds that include the engine project. Disabled only when building standalone apps that only link with Core.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAgainstCoreUObject
member.summary: Enabled for all builds that include the CoreUObject project. Disabled only when building standalone apps that only link with Core.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAgainstApplicationCore
member.summary: Enabled for builds that need to initialize the ApplicationCore module. Command line utilities do not normally need this.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAgainstEditorOverride
member.summary: Manually specified value for bCompileAgainstEditor.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAgainstEditor
member.summary: Enabled for editor builds (TargetType.Editor). Can be overridden for programs (TargetType.Program) that would need to compile against editor code. Not available for other target types. Mainly drives the value of WITH_EDITOR.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileRecast
member.summary: Whether to compile Recast navmesh generation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileNavmeshSegmentLinks
member.summary: Whether to compile with navmesh segment links.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileNavmeshClusterLinks
member.summary: Whether to compile with navmesh cluster links.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bOverrideCompileSpeedTree
member.summary: Whether to compile SpeedTree support.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileSpeedTree
member.summary: Whether we should compile in support for SpeedTree or not.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceEnableExceptions
member.summary: Enable exceptions for all modules.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseInlining
member.summary: Enable inlining for all modules.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceEnableObjCExceptions
member.summary: Enable exceptions for all modules.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceEnableRTTI
member.summary: Enable RTTI for all modules.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithServerCode
member.summary: Compile server-only code.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithServerCodeTrusted
member.summary: Compile trusted-server-only code.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithServerCodeUntrusted
member.summary: Compile untrusted-server-only code.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bFNameOutlineNumber
member.summary: Compile with FName storing the number part in the name table. Saves memory when most names are not numbered and those that are are referenced multiple times. The game and engine must ensure they reuse numbered names similarly to name strings to avoid leaking memory.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithPushModel
member.summary: When enabled, Push Model Networking support will be compiled in. This can help reduce CPU overhead of networking, at the cost of more memory. Always enabled in editor builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileWithStatsWithoutEngine
member.summary: Whether to include stats support even without the engine.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileWithPluginSupport
member.summary: Whether to include plugin support.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bIncludePluginsForTargetPlatforms
member.summary: Whether to allow plugins which support all target platforms.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileWithAccessibilitySupport
member.summary: Whether to allow accessibility code in both Slate and the OS layer.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithPerfCounters
member.summary: Whether to include PerfCounters support.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithLiveCoding
member.summary: Whether to enable support for live coding

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseDebugLiveCodingConsole
member.summary: Whether to enable support for live coding

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithDirectXMath
member.summary: Whether to enable support for DirectX Math LWC_TODO: No longer supported. Needs removing.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseLoggingInShipping
member.summary: Whether to turn on logging for test/shipping builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bLoggingToMemoryEnabled
member.summary: Whether to turn on logging to memory for test/shipping builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseLauncherChecks
member.summary: Whether to check that the process was launched through an external launcher.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseChecksInShipping
member.summary: Whether to turn on checks (asserts) for test/shipping builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bTCHARIsUTF8
member.summary: Whether to turn on UTF-8 mode, mapping TCHAR to UTF8CHAR.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseEstimatedUtcNow
member.summary: Whether to use the EstimatedUtcNow or PlatformUtcNow. EstimatedUtcNow is appropriate in cases where PlatformUtcNow can be slow.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileFreeType
member.summary: True if we need FreeType support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileForSize
member.summary: True if we want to favor optimizing size over speed.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.OptimizationLevel
member.summary: Allows to fine tune optimizations level for speed and\or code size

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceCompileDevelopmentAutomationTests
member.summary: Whether to compile development automation tests.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceCompilePerformanceAutomationTests
member.summary: Whether to compile performance automation tests.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceDisableAutomationTests
member.summary: Whether to override the defaults for automation tests (Debug/Development configs)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEventDrivenLoader
member.summary: If true, event driven loader will be used in cooked builds. @todoio This needs to be replaced by a runtime solution after async loading refactor.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.NativePointerMemberBehaviorOverride
member.summary: Used to override the behavior controlling whether UCLASSes and USTRUCTs are allowed to have native pointer members, if disallowed they will be a UHT error and should be substituted with TObjectPtr members instead.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseXGEController
member.summary: Whether the XGE controller worker and modules should be included in the engine build. These are required for distributed shader compilation using the XGE interception interface.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bIWYU
member.summary: Enables "include what you use" by default for modules in this target. Changes the default PCH mode for any module in this project to PCHUsageMode.UseExplicitOrSharedPCHs.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnforceIWYU
member.summary: Enforce "include what you use" rules; warns if monolithic headers (Engine.h, UnrealEd.h, etc...) are used, and checks that source files include their matching header first.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bHasExports
member.summary: Whether the final executable should export symbols.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPrecompile
member.summary: Make static libraries for all engine modules as intermediates for this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnableOSX109Support
member.summary: Whether we should compile with support for OS X 10.9 Mavericks. Used for some tools that we need to be compatible with this version of OS X.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bIsBuildingConsoleApplication
member.summary: True if this is a console application that's being built.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildAdditionalConsoleApp
member.summary: If true, creates an additional console application. Hack for Windows, where it's not possible to conditionally inherit a parent's console Window depending on how the application is invoked; you have to link the same executable with a different subsystem setting.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableSymbolCache
member.summary: True if debug symbols that are cached for some platforms should not be created.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseUnityBuild
member.summary: Whether to unify C++ code into larger files for faster compilation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseUnityBuildOverride
member.summary: Whether to unify C++ code into larger files for faster compilation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceUnityBuild
member.summary: Whether to force C++ source files to be combined into larger files for faster compilation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bMergeModuleAndGeneratedUnityFiles
member.summary: Whether to merge module and generated unity files for faster compilation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseAdaptiveUnityBuild
member.summary: Use a heuristic to determine which files are currently being iterated on and exclude them from unity blobs, result in faster incremental compile times. The current implementation uses the read-only flag to distinguish the working set, assuming that files will be made writable by the source control system if they are being modified. This is true for Perforce, but not for Git.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityDisablesOptimizations
member.summary: Disable optimization for files that are in the adaptive non-unity working set.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityDisablesPCH
member.summary: Disables force-included PCHs for files that are in the adaptive non-unity working set.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityDisablesProjectPCHForProjectPrivate
member.summary: Backing storage for bAdaptiveUnityDisablesProjectPCH.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityDisablesPCHForProject
member.summary: Whether to disable force-included PCHs for project source files in the adaptive non-unity working set. Defaults to bAdaptiveUnityDisablesPCH;

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityCreatesDedicatedPCH
member.summary: Creates a dedicated PCH for each source file in the working set, allowing faster iteration on cpp-only changes.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityEnablesEditAndContinue
member.summary: Creates a dedicated PCH for each source file in the working set, allowing faster iteration on cpp-only changes.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityCompilesHeaderFiles
member.summary: Creates a dedicated source file for each header file in the working set to detect missing includes in headers.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.MinGameModuleSourceFilesForUnityBuild
member.summary: The number of source files in a game module before unity build will be activated for that module. This allows small game modules to have faster iterative compile times for single files, at the expense of slower full rebuild times. This setting can be overridden by the bFasterWithoutUnity option in a module's Build.cs file.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.DefaultWarningLevel
member.summary: Default treatment of uncategorized warnings

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.DeprecationWarningLevel
member.summary: Level to report deprecation warnings as errors

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.ShadowVariableWarningLevel
member.summary: Forces shadow variable warnings to be treated as errors on platforms that support it.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWarningsAsErrors
member.summary: Whether to enable all warnings as errors. UE enables most warnings as errors already, but disables a few (such as deprecation warnings).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.UnsafeTypeCastWarningLevel
member.summary: Indicates what warning/error level to treat unsafe type casts as on platforms that support it (e.g., double->float or int64->int32)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUndefinedIdentifierErrors
member.summary: Forces the use of undefined identifiers in conditional expressions to be treated as errors.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bRetainFramePointers
member.summary: Forces frame pointers to be retained this is usually required when you want reliable callstacks e.g. mallocframeprofiler

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bRetainFramePointersOverride
member.summary: Forces frame pointers to be retained this is usually required when you want reliable callstacks e.g. mallocframeprofiler

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseFastMonoCalls
member.summary: New Monolithic Graphics drivers have optional "fast calls" replacing various D3d functions

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.NumIncludedBytesPerUnityCPP
member.summary: An approximate number of bytes of C++ code to target for inclusion in a single unified C++ file.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bStressTestUnity
member.summary: Whether to stress test the C++ unity build robustness by including all C++ files files in a project from a single unified file.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDetailedUnityFiles
member.summary: Whether to add additional information to the unity files, such as '_of_X' in the file name.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceDebugInfo
member.summary: Whether to force debug info to be generated.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableDebugInfo
member.summary: Whether to globally disable debug info generation; see DebugInfoHeuristics.cs for per-config and per-platform options.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableDebugInfoForGeneratedCode
member.summary: Whether to disable debug info generation for generated files. This improves link times for modules that have a lot of generated glue code.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bOmitPCDebugInfoInDevelopment
member.summary: Whether to disable debug info on PC/Mac in development builds (for faster developer iteration, as link times are extremely fast with debug info disabled).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsePDBFiles
member.summary: Whether PDB files should be used for Visual C++ builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsePCHFiles
member.summary: Whether PCH files should be used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDeterministic
member.summary: Set flags require for determinstic linking (experimental, may not be fully supported). Deterministic compiling is controlled via ModuleRules.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceDeterministic
member.summary: Force set flags require for determinstic compiling and linking (experimental, may not be fully supported). This setting is only recommended for testing, instead: * Set bDeterministic on a per module basis in ModuleRules to control deterministic compiling. * Set bDeterministic on a per target basis in TargetRules to control deterministic linking.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceIncludePCHHeadersForGenCppFilesWhenPCHIsDisabled
member.summary: Whether PCH headers should be force included for gen.cpp files when PCH is disabled.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPreprocessOnly
member.summary: Whether to just preprocess source files for this target, and skip compilation

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPreprocessDepends
member.summary: Generate dependency files by preprocessing. This is only recommended when distributing builds as it adds additional overhead.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.StaticAnalyzer
member.summary: Whether static code analysis should be enabled.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.StaticAnalyzerOutputType
member.summary: The output type to use for the static analyzer. This is only supported for Clang.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.StaticAnalyzerMode
member.summary: The mode to use for the static analyzer. This is only supported for Clang. Shallow mode completes quicker but is generally not recommended.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.MinFilesUsingPrecompiledHeader
member.summary: The minimum number of files that must use a pre-compiled header before it will be created and used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForcePrecompiledHeaderForGameModules
member.summary: When enabled, a precompiled header is always generated for game modules, even if there are only a few source files in the module. This greatly improves compile times for iterative changes on a few files in the project, at the expense of slower full rebuild times for small game projects. This can be overridden by setting MinFilesUsingPrecompiledHeaderOverride in a module's Build.cs file.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseIncrementalLinking
member.summary: Whether to use incremental linking or not. Incremental linking can yield faster iteration times when making small changes. Currently disabled by default because it tends to behave a bit buggy on some computers (PDB-related compile errors).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAllowLTCG
member.summary: Whether to allow the use of link time code generation (LTCG).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPreferThinLTO
member.summary: When Link Time Code Generation (LTCG) is enabled, whether to prefer using the lighter weight version on supported platforms.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPGOProfile
member.summary: Whether to enable Profile Guided Optimization (PGO) instrumentation in this build.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPGOOptimize
member.summary: Whether to optimize this build with Profile Guided Optimization (PGO).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bSupportEditAndContinue
member.summary: Whether to support edit and continue. Only works on Microsoft compilers.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bOmitFramePointers
member.summary: Whether to omit frame pointers or not. Disabling is useful for e.g. memory profiling on the PC.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnableCppModules
member.summary: Whether to enable support for C++20 modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnableCppCoroutinesForEvaluation
member.summary: Whether to enable support for C++20 coroutines This option is provided to facilitate evaluation of the feature. Expect the name of the option to change. Use of coroutines in with UE is untested and unsupported.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnableProcessPriorityControl
member.summary: Whether to enable engine's ability to set process priority on runtime. This option requires some environment setup on Linux, that's why it's disabled by default. Project has to opt-in this feature as it has to guarantee correct setup.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseMallocProfiler
member.summary: If true, then enable memory profiling in the build (defines USE_MALLOC_PROFILER=1 and forces bOmitFramePointers=false).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseSharedPCHs
member.summary: Enables "Shared PCHs", a feature which significantly speeds up compile times by attempting to share certain PCH files between modules that UBT detects is including those PCH's header files.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseShippingPhysXLibraries
member.summary: True if Development and Release builds should use the release configuration of PhysX/APEX.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseCheckedPhysXLibraries
member.summary: True if Development and Release builds should use the checked configuration of PhysX/APEX. if bUseShippingPhysXLibraries is true this is ignored.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCheckLicenseViolations
member.summary: Tells the UBT to check if module currently being built is violating EULA.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBreakBuildOnLicenseViolation
member.summary: Tells the UBT to break build if module currently being built is violating EULA.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseFastPDBLinking
member.summary: Whether to use the :FASTLINK option when building with /DEBUG to create local PDBs on Windows. Fast, but currently seems to have problems finding symbols in the debugger.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCreateMapFile
member.summary: Outputs a map file as part of the build.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAllowRuntimeSymbolFiles
member.summary: True if runtime symbols files should be generated as a post build step for some platforms. These files are used by the engine to resolve symbol names of callstack backtraces in logs.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.PackagePath
member.summary: Package full path (directory + filename) where to store input files used at link time Normally used to debug a linker crash for platforms that support it

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.CrashDiagnosticDirectory
member.summary: Directory where to put crash report files for platforms that support it

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.BundleVersion
member.summary: Bundle version for Mac apps.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDeployAfterCompile
member.summary: Whether to deploy the executable after compilation on platforms that require deployment.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceSkipDeploy
member.summary: Whether to force skipping deployment for platforms that require deployment by default.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAllowRemotelyCompiledPCHs
member.summary: When enabled, allows XGE to compile pre-compiled header files on remote machines. Otherwise, PCHs are always generated locally.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCheckSystemHeadersForModification
member.summary: Whether headers in system paths should be checked for modification when determining outdated actions.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableLinking
member.summary: Whether to disable linking for this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bIgnoreBuildOutputs
member.summary: Whether to ignore tracking build outputs for this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bFormalBuild
member.summary: Indicates that this is a formal build, intended for distribution. This flag is automatically set to true when Build.version has a changelist set. The only behavior currently bound to this flag is to compile the default resource file separately for each binary so that the OriginalFilename field is set correctly. By default, we only compile the resource once to reduce build times.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bFlushBuildDirOnRemoteMac
member.summary: Whether to clean Builds directory on a remote Mac before building.

member.summary: Whether to write detailed timing info from the compiler and linker.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bParseTimingInfoForTracing
member.summary: Whether to parse timing data into a tracing file compatible with chrome://tracing.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPublicSymbolsByDefault
member.summary: Whether to expose all symbols as public by default on POSIX platforms

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableInliningGenCpps
member.summary: Disable supports for inlining gen.cpps

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.PostBuildSteps

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEBuildPlatform.RequiresLoadOrderManifest(UnrealBuildTool.ReadOnlyTargetRules)
member.summary: Indicates whether this platform requires a .loadorder file to be generated for the build. .loadorder files contain a list of dynamic modules and the exact order in which they should be loaded to ensure that all dependencies are satisfied i.e. we don't attempt to load a module without loading all its dependencies first. As such, this file is only needed in modular builds on some platforms (depending on the way they implement dynamic modules such as DLLs).
member.returns: True if .loadorder file should be generated

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEBuildTarget.CleanStaleModules(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary:
Cleans any stale modules that have changed moved output folder.
On Windows, the loader reads imported DLLs from the first location it finds them. If modules are moved from one place to another, we have to be sure to clean up the old versions so that they're not loaded accidentally causing unintuitive import errors.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.HordeExecutor
member.summary:
Highly experimental, a work in progress and not currently in active use. * This executor uses Horde Compute to build actions remotely. Requests are made to Horde via a local Zen server. * Currently only supported for Linux and Mac toolchains.
Current Requirements: * -PreprocessDepends: Run a prepass of clang to generate the dependency list. Needed to get all input files required to compile. This will add additional overhead to the build and is not recommended unless using Horde compute remote distribution. * -NoPCH: Cannot build with pch, as absolute paths are embedded into the .gch file for included headers, and these paths must exist exactly. * -HordeCompute: Flag to enable this executor * ZenServer: Must be running with the correct credentials to connect to both Horde Storage to upload files and Horde to make execution requests. Can be launched via -LaunchZenServer.
TODO: * Investigate overhead when connecting from Zen to Horde * Local process racing when remote tasks are blocking more tasks from starting, or at the end of a build. * Print more concise and useful summary at the end of the build * Additional toolchain platform support * Dynamic control over the number of remote processes to run at once. Needs knowledge about availibility of remote compute resources, if the pending remote queue is overloaded and by how much, etc.

member.summary: How many processes that will be executed in parallel remotely

member.summary: Maximum processor count for local execution.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ParallelExecutor.ProcessorCountMultiplier
member.summary: Processor count multiplier for local execution. Can be below 1 to reserve CPU for other tasks. When using the local executor (not XGE), run a single action on each CPU core. Note that you can set this to a larger value to get slightly faster build times in many cases, but your computer's responsiveness during compiling may be much worse. This value is ignored if the CPU does not support hyper-threading.

member.summary: Free memory per action in bytes, used to limit the number of parallel actions if the machine is memory starved. Set to 0 to disable free memory checking.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.TestMode.BuildTests(System.Collections.Generic.List{UnrealBuildTool.TargetDescriptor},UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Build tests for a list of targets. It generates artificial test target descriptors to build a target AND its dependencies's tests in one monolithic executable. Each module containing a "Tests" folder is included. The target that we generate the tests executable for must include a main.cpp file and Setup and Teardown methods. The generated executable is the target name + "Tests", e.g. UnrealEditorTests.exe Passing UnrealEditor here would build all the tests in all the modules.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEDeployIOS.VersionUtilities.PullApartVersion(System.String,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.String@)
member.summary: Pulls apart a version string of one of the two following formats: "7301.15 11-01 10:28" (Major.Minor Date Time) "7486.0" (Major.Minor)

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEDeployIOS.VersionUtilities.CalculateUpdatedMinorVersionString(System.String)
member.summary:
Parses the version string (expected to be of the form major.minor or major) Also parses the major.minor from the running version file and increments it's minor by 1.
If the running version major matches and the running version minor is newer, then the bundle version is updated.
In either case, the running version is set to the current bundle version number and written back out.
member.returns: The (possibly updated) bundle version

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEDeployIOS.VersionUtilities.UpdateBundleVersion(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the minor version in the CFBundleVersion key of the specified PList if this is a new package. Also updates the key EpicAppVersion with the bundle version and the current date/time (no year)

member.summary: For each root location relevant to install dirs, look for the given key and add its subkeys to the set of subkeys to return. member.param: The subkey to look for under each root location
member.returns: A list of unique subkeys found under any of the existing subkeys

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzer
member.summary: Which static analyzer to use

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzer.None
member.summary: Do not perform static analysis

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzer.Default
member.summary: Use the default static analyzer for the selected compiler, if it has one. For Visual Studio and Clang, this means using their built-in static analysis tools. Any compiler that doesn't support static analysis will ignore this option.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzer.VisualCpp
member.summary: Use the built-in Visual C++ static analyzer

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzer.PVSStudio
member.summary: Use PVS-Studio for static analysis

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzer.Clang
member.summary: Use clang for static analysis. This forces the compiler to clang.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzerOutputType
member.summary: Output type for the static analyzer. This currently only works for the Clang static analyzer. The Clang static analyzer can do either Text, which prints the analysis to stdout, or html, where it writes out a navigable HTML page for each issue that it finds, per file. The HTML is output in the same directory as the object fil that would otherwise have been generated. All other analyzers default automatically to Text.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzerOutputType.Text
member.summary: Output the analysis to stdout.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsStaticAnalyzerOutputType.Html
member.summary: Output the analysis to an HTML file in the object folder.

member.summary: Available architectures on Windows platform

member.summary: ARM64

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules
member.summary: Windows-specific target settings

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.Target
member.summary: The target rules which owns this object. Used to resolve some properties.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.Compiler
member.summary: Version of the compiler toolchain to use on Windows platform. A value of "default" will be changed to a specific version at UBT start up.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.ToolChain
member.summary: Version of the toolchain to use on Windows platform when a non-msvc Compiler is in use, to locate include paths etc.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.Architecture
member.summary: Architecture of Target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.CompilerVersion
member.summary: The specific toolchain version to use. This may be a specific version number (for example, "14.13.26128"), the string "Latest" to select the newest available version, or the string "Preview" to select the newest available preview version. By default, and if it is available, we use the toolchain version indicated by WindowsPlatform.DefaultToolChainVersion (otherwise, we use the latest version).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.WindowsSdkVersion
member.summary: The specific Windows SDK version to use. This may be a specific version number (for example, "8.1", "10.0" or "10.0.10150.0"), or the string "Latest", to select the newest available version. By default, and if it is available, we use the Windows SDK version indicated by WindowsPlatform.DefaultWindowsSdkVersion (otherwise, we use the latest version).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.TargetWindowsVersion
member.summary: Value for the WINVER macro, defining the minimum supported Windows version.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bPixProfilingEnabled
member.summary: Enable PIX debugging (automatically disabled in Shipping and Test configs)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bUseWindowsSDK10
member.summary: Enable building with the Win10 SDK instead of the older Win8.1 SDK

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bUseCPPWinRT
member.summary: Enable building with the C++/WinRT language projection

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bEnableRayTracing
member.summary: Enables runtime ray tracing support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.CompanyName
member.summary: The name of the company (author, provider) that created the project.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.CopyrightNotice
member.summary: The project's copyright and/or trademark notices.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.ProductName
member.summary: The product name.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.StaticAnalyzer
member.summary: The static analyzer to use.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.StaticAnalyzerOutputType
member.summary: The output type to use for the static analyzer.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bEnableAddressSanitizer
member.summary: Enables address sanitizer (ASan). Only supported for Visual Studio 2019 16.7.0 and up.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.ObjSrcMapFile
member.summary: Whether we should export a file containing .obj to source file mappings.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.ModuleDefinitionFile
member.summary: Provides a Module Definition File (.def) to the linker to describe various attributes of a DLL. Necessary when exporting functions by ordinal values instead of by name.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.ManifestFile
member.summary: Specifies the path to a manifest file for the linker to embed. Defaults to the manifest in Engine/Build/Windows/Resources. Can be assigned to null if the target wants to specify its own manifest.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bStrictConformanceMode
member.summary: Enables strict standard conformance mode (/permissive-).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bUpdatedCPPMacro
member.summary: Enables updated __cplusplus macro (/Zc:__cplusplus).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bStrictInlineConformance
member.summary: Enables inline conformance (Remove unreferenced COMDAT) (/Zc:inline).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bStrictPreprocessorConformance
member.summary: Enables new preprocessor conformance (/Zc:preprocessor).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bStrictEnumTypesConformance
member.summary: Enables enum types conformance (/Zc:enumTypes) in VS2022 17.4 Preview 4.0+.

members.member: VS2015 updated some of the CRT definitions but not all of the Windows SDK has been updated to match. Microsoft provides legacy_stdio_definitions library to enable building with VS2015 until they fix everything up.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.PCHMemoryAllocationFactor

member.summary: Allow the target to specify extra options for linking that aren't otherwise noted here

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bStripUnreferencedSymbols
member.summary: Strip unreferenced symbols (/OPT:REF)

member.summary: Merge identical COMDAT sections together (/OPT:ICF)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bOptimizeGlobalData
member.summary: Whether to put global symbols in their own sections (/Gw), allowing the linker to discard any that are unused.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bClangTimeTrace
member.summary: (Experimental) Appends the -ftime-trace argument to the command line for Clang to output a JSON file containing a timeline for the compile. See http://aras-p.info/blog/2019/01/16/time-trace-timeline-flame-chart-profiler-for-Clang/ for more info.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.WindowsTargetRules.bUseBundledDbgHelp
member.summary: Bundle a working version of dbghelp.dll with the application, and use this to generate minidumps. This works around a bug with the Windows 10 Fall Creators Update (1709) where rich PE headers larger than a certain size would result in corrupt minidumps.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ProjectFileComparer.CompareOrdinalIgnoreWhitespaceAndCase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two project files ignoring whitespaces, case and GUIDs.
member.remarks: Compares two specified String objects by evaluating the numeric values of the corresponding Char objects in each string. Only space and tabulation characters are ignored. Ignores leading whitespaces at the beginning of each line and differences in whitespace sequences between matching non-whitespace sub-strings.
member.returns: An integer that indicates the lexical relationship between the two comparands.

member.summary: Write project file info in JSON file. For every combination of UnrealTargetPlatform, UnrealTargetConfiguration and TargetType will be generated separate JSON file. Project file will be stored: For UE: {UnrealRoot}/Engine/Intermediate/ProjectFiles/.Rider/{Platform}/{Configuration}/{TargetType}/{ProjectName}.json For game: {GameRoot}/Intermediate/ProjectFiles/.Rider/{Platform}/{Configuration}/{TargetType}/{ProjectName}.json
member.remarks: * TargetType.Editor will be generated for current platform only and will ignore UnrealTargetConfiguration.Test and UnrealTargetConfiguration.Shipping configurations * TargetType.Program will be generated for current platform only and UnrealTargetConfiguration.Development configuration only

member.summary: Given a target platform and configuration, generates a platform and configuration name string to use in Visual Studio projects. Unlike with solution configurations, Visual Studio project configurations only support certain types of platforms, so we'll generate a configuration name that has the platform "built in", and use a default platform type

Name of platform string to use for Visual Studio project
Name of configuration string to use for Visual Studio project

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.VCProjectFileSettings.MaxSharedIncludePaths
member.summary: Puts the most common include paths in the IncludePath property in the MSBuild project. This significantly reduces Visual Studio memory usage (measured 1.1GB -> 500mb), but seems to be causing issues with Visual Assist. Value here specifies maximum length of the include path list in KB.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.VCProjectFileSettings.ExcludedIncludePaths
member.summary: Semi-colon separated list of paths that should not be added to the projects include paths. Useful for omitting third-party headers (e.g ThirdParty/WebRTC) from intellisense suggestions and reducing memory footprints.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.VCProjectFileSettings.ExcludedFilePaths
member.summary: Semi-colon separated list of paths that should not be added to the projects. Useful for omitting third-party files (e.g ThirdParty/WebRTC) from intellisense suggestions and reducing memory footprints.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ProjectFiles.Xcode.XcodeFrameworkWrapperProject.DeleteUnwantedDirectories(System.String)

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ProjectFiles.Xcode.XcodeFrameworkWrapperProject.GenerateXcodeFrameworkWrapper(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Generates an Xcode project that acts as a native wrapper around an Unreal Project built as a framework.
Wrapper projects are generated by copying a template xcode project from the Build Resources directory, deleting any user-specific or build files, renaming files and folders to match the framework, setting specific settings in the project to accommodate the framework, and replacing text in all the files to match the framework.
member.param: The directory in which to place the framework. The framework will be placed in 'outputDirectory/frameworkName/'.
The name of the project. If blueprint-only, use the actual name of the project, not just UnrealGame.
The name of the framework that this project is wrapping.
The Bundle ID to give to the wrapper project.
The path to the directory containing the framework to be wrapped.
The path to the root Unreal Engine directory.
The path to the 'cookeddata' folder that accompanies the framework.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.XcodeProjectXcconfig.UnrealData.GetSupportedMacArchitectures(UnrealBuildTool.XcodeProjectXcconfig.UnrealBuildConfig,EpicGames.Core.FileReference)
member.summary:
Returns the Mac architectures that should be configured for the provided target. If the target has a project we'll adhere to whether it's set as Intel/Universal/Apple unless the type is denied (pretty much just Editor)
If the target has no project we'll support allow-listed targets for installed builds and all non-editor architectures for source builds. Not all programs are going to compile for Apple Silicon, but being able to build and fail is useful...
member.param: Build config for the target we're generating
Path to the project file, or null if the target has no project

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ConfigHierarchy.GetStructEntryForSetting(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an ini setting, and then pulls the value for a property out of a struct, in the format: [SomeSection] SomeStruct=(Foo=Bar,Prop="My Value")
member.param: Name of the struct setting ('SomeStruct' in this example)
Name of the property inside the struct ('Prop' in this example)
member.returns: The value retrieved from the struct ('My Value' in this example), or null if anything was not found

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ConfigHierarchy.GetStructEntry(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pulls the value for a property out of a struct in the given input, in the format: (Foo=Bar,Prop="My Value")
member.param: The entire struct as retrieved from the ini via GetString()
Name of the property inside the struct ('Prop' in this example)
Pass true when the value pulled is an array, like (Foo=(X=1,Y=2)), this would return X=1,Y=2
member.returns: The value retrieved from the struct ('My Value' in this example), or null if anything was not found

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ConfigHierarchy.GetMapValueForSetting(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an ini setting, and then pulls the value for a property out of a map, in the format: [SomeSection] SomeMap=((Foo=Bar),(SomeKey="My Value"))
member.param: Name of the struct setting ('SomeMap' in this example)
Name of the key inside the struct ('SomeKey' in this example)
member.returns: The value retrieved from the map ('My Value' in this example), or null if anything was not found

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ConfigHierarchy.GetMapValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Pulls the value for a property out of a struct in the given input, in the format: ((Foo=Bar),(SomeKey="My Value"))
member.param: The entire struct as retrieved from the ini via GetString()
Name of the key inside the struct ('SomeKey' in this example). Key cannot have escaped quotes or commas
member.returns: The value retrieved from the map ('My Value' in this example), or null if anything was not found

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.CppConfiguration
member.summary: Compiler configuration. This controls whether to use define debug macros and other compiler settings. Note that optimization level should be based on the bOptimizeCode variable rather than this setting, so it can be modified on a per-module basis without introducing an incompatibility between object files or PCHs.

member.summary: Direct the compiler to generate AVX instructions wherever SSE or AVX intrinsics are used. Note that by enabling this you are changing the minspec for the PC platform, and the resultant executable will crash on machines without AVX support.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.LoadOrderManifest
member.summary:
Manifest file (.loadorder) describing the order in which all dynamic modules should be loaded. For this reason, it's only relevant to modular builds on some platforms.
This file exists because on some non-Windows platforms dynamic modules (such as DLLs) don't support dependencies and it's our responsibility to load them in the right order (Windows DLLs know which other DLLs they rely on and these dependencies are guaranteed to be loaded first). If we fail respect this order, we're likely to get crashes e.g. when global statics are being initialized because some dereferenced globals may not be available yet (null).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.LoadOrderManifest.Libraries
member.summary: List of all project's dynamic modules in the order in which they should be loaded. All paths are relative to the main binary's directory.

member.summary: Gets a filename for a load order manifest for a build with the given platform/configuration.
member.param: The modular app name being built
The architecture of the target platform
member.returns: Filename for the app receipt

member.summary: Read the load order manifest from a file.
member.returns: The receipt that was read

member.summary: Write the load order manifest to a file.

member.summary: Write the load order manifest to a text writer.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleManifest
member.summary:
Stores the version (or a unique build ID) for the modules for a target in a certain folder.
This allows the runtime to identify which modules are used for which files, and which version they're at. This prevents stale binaries from being loaded by the runtime when making a local unversioned build, and allows faster incremental builds than compiling the build changelist into every module when making versioned builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PluginDescriptor.Version
member.summary: Version number for the plugin. The version number must increase with every version of the plugin, so that the system can determine whether one version of a plugin is newer than another, or to enforce other requirements. This version number is not displayed in front-facing UI. Use the VersionName for that.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PluginDescriptor.VersionName
member.summary: Name of the version for this plugin. This is the front-facing part of the version number. It doesn't need to match the version number numerically, but should be updated when the version number is increased accordingly.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.PluginSet
member.summary: Represents a group of plugins all sharing the same name -- notionally all different versions of the same plugin. Since UE can only manage a single plugin of a given name (to avoid module conflicts, etc.), this object prioritizes and bubbles up a single "choice" plugin from the set -- see `ChoiceVersion`.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PluginSet.Name
member.summary: Shared name that all the plugins in the set go by.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PluginSet.KnownVersions
member.summary: Unordered list of all the discovered plugins matching the above name.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.PluginSet.#ctor(UnrealBuildTool.PluginInfo)
member.summary: Constructor which takes the specified PluginInfo and adds it to the set.
member.param: The fist plugin discovered for this set -- will automatically be prioritized as the "choice" plugin.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.PluginSet.Add(UnrealBuildTool.PluginInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pushes the specified PluginInfo into the set, and optionally promotes it to the new "choice" version.
member.param: The new plugin to add to this set (its name should match this set's name)
Whether or not to make this the new prioritized "choice" plugin in the set.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.PluginSet.ChoiceVersion
member.summary: The single plugin, out of the entire set, that we prioritize to be built and utilized by UE.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.PluginSet.IndexOfChoiceVersion
member.summary: An index that we use to identify which plugin in the list is the prioritized "choice" version.
