member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1
member.summary:
Helper class implementing the standard topological sorting algorithm for directed graphs. It generates a flattened sequence of nodes in the order that respects all the given dependencies between nodes (edges). So, if we have edges A -> B and B -> C, A will be always before B and C, and B will be before C.
In many cases there are more than one possible solutions. This helper just generates one of them. The algorithm only works for directed acyclic graphs, as otherwise it's impossible to order the nodes. In this implementation we can choose how cycles should be handled (CycleHandling member). By default sorting fails, but we may set the class to arbitrarily break cycles and complete the task.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.CycleMode
member.summary: Enumeration indicating how graph cycles should be handled.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.CycleMode.Fail
member.summary: Fail sorting on the first cycle encountered (the algorithmically correct solution).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.CycleMode.Break
member.summary: Break cycles at the point they are detected (allows the algorithm to always complete but may skip some edges).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.CycleMode.BreakWithInfo
member.summary: Break cycles at the point they are detected (same as Break but outputs warning logs with information about the cycles).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.CycleHandling
member.summary: Determines what should be done when a cycle in the graph is encountered.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.Logger
member.summary: UBT's logger object. Necessary if we want to get diagnostics, especially when BreakWithInfo is used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.NodeToString
member.summary: Functor returning a node's name. Necessary for some logging diagnostics, especially when BreakWithInfo is used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.Nodes
member.summary: List of all graph nodes (each user-provided node T is wrapped in an internal GraphNode).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.Callstack
member.summary: When traversing the graph, it represents all the nodes visited in the current sequence. For instance, if we go from node A to K and then X, Callstack will store A, K, X. It's only needed for diagnostic purposes i.e. when we find a cycle we use Callstack to output all the cycle's nodes.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.Result
member.summary: The resulting sequence of nodes (T, provided by the user) in the topological order.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Tuple{`0,`0}})
member.summary: Initialize the sorter object and create the internal graph representation. The list of all the graph nodes doesn't need to be provided because it's internally generated from Edges (union of all edges' Item1 and Item2.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.Sort
member.summary: Sort the graph to generate a flat sequence of nodes respecting all graph dependencies.
member.returns: True on success, false if failed (most likely a cycle encountered)

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.TopologicalSorter`1.GetResult
member.summary: Get the list of sorted nodes (valid after successfully calling Sort).

member.summary: Process a single node.
member.returns: True on success, false if failed (most likely a cycle encountered)

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.Unity.FileCollection.AddVirtualFile(UnrealBuildBase.FileItem)
member.summary: Doesn't actually add a file, but instead reserves space. This is used with "bUseAdaptiveUnityBuild", to prevent other compiled unity blobs in the module's numbered set from having to be recompiled after we eject source files one of that module's unity blobs. Basically, it can prevent dozens of files from being recompiled after the first time building after your working set of source files changes
member.param: The virtual file to add to the collection

member.summary: Returns the list of built unity files. The UnityFileBuilder is unusable after this.

Given a set of C++ files, generates another set of C++ files that #include all the original files, the goal being to compile the same code in fewer translation units. The "unity" files are written to the IntermediateDirectory.

The environment that is used to compile the C++ files.
Interface to query files which belong to the working set
Base name to use for the Unity files

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.Utils.GetEncodingForStrings(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})

member.returns: Either System.Text.Encoding.ASCII or System.Text.Encoding.UTF8, depending on whether or not the strings contains non-ASCII characters.

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.HoloLensManifestGenerator.GetInterprettedSettingValue(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve a package configuration option from the deprecated [AppxManifest] INI settings and return the value. NOTE: Do not use this method for storing values, it is left in purely for compatibility. All package configuration should be done using the target settings in the editor or in the [/Script/HoloLensPlatformEditor.HoloLensTargetSettings] INI section. Values are stored in the following format. Sample INI setting: Package.Capabilities.mx:Capability[0].Name=kinectAudio Corresponding XML output: <Package> <Capabilities> <mx:Capability Name="kinectAudio"> Symbol Key: $Section:Key$ Look up Key in Section in INI files (Game first then fall back to Engine). Replace symbol with INI setting value. %RelativeExePath% Replace value with path to exe from package root. %Insert:Path% Insert contents of file at Path based off of project root path. Will indent all lines in the file by the current value of Indent. File should contain valid XML (this is not verified).
member.param: Optional index of setting for [n] type LookupStrings
Optional current indent count (used when writing %Insert:Path% values
member.returns: INI value for key LookupString post interpretation
